#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Johann Georg Bendl
#Text=Johann-Georg Bendl
#Text=( Czech pronunciation : [ ˈjohaŋ ˈɡɛorɡ ˈbɛndl̩ ] ) or Jan Jiří Bendl ( [ ˈjan ˈjɪr̝iː ˈbɛndl̩ ] ) ( before 1620 - Prague , 27 May 1680 ) was a Baroque sculptor , who worked mainly in Prague .
#Text=He was the son of the Bohemian sculptor Georg Bendl ( born ca .
#Text=1570 , Prague , died 1656 ) .
#Text=Works
#Text=The wooden pulpit ( since destroyed ) of the St. Wenceslas Church ( of the Augustinian Order ) in Prague , was probably one of his earliest works .
#Text=He also sculpted the pulpit in the church Kostel Panny Marie pod Řetězem in the Prague district Malá Strana .
#Text=All the most important churches in Prague eventually would order one or more statues .
#Text=In 1648 he sculpted the statues for side chapels in the Church of Our Lady of Týn , the church on the main square of Prague .
#Text=He decorated the dome of the St. Salvator church of the Jesuit Order in Prague with stucco in the period 1648-1649 .

#Text=This would later bring in new orders from these Jesuits in 1655-1660 to sculpt the stone statues for the portico and the pediment of the façade ; at the end of his life , in 1675 , he would carve a series of wooden statues of Apostles for confessionals for the same church .

#Text=He was commissioned in 1650 by Ferdinand III , Holy Roman Emperor to produce in Prague a sculpture of the Immaculate Conception to commemorate the Peace of Westphalia ending the Thirty Years ' War in 1648 .
#Text=Around 1650 he also sculpted a number of wooden angels for the Servite Order , now on display in St. George 's Convent , National Gallery in Prague .

#Text=That same year he was asked to make the statues for the main altar of the Church of the Holy Cross ( now on the high altar of the St. Jindrich 's ( St. Henry 's ) church ) and he carved a statue of a saint for the same church at some time in the 1650s , now at the City Museum of Prague )
#Text=His monumental Marian column ( 1650 ) on the Old Town Square in Prague ( destroyed in 1918 ) would set an example of Baroque style for the next decades .
#Text=Remaining part can be seen at the Lapidarium of the National Museum of Prague .
#Text=He sculpted six statues of the Doctors of the Church in 1659 .
#Text=The high-quality bronzed statues of St. Jerome and Mary Magdalen in the Chapel of St. Vincent Ferrer ( Dominican church , Vienna ) were produced by his workshop .
#Text=He decorated the façade of the St. Salvator Church in Prague with several statues : ( on top ) Christ with the four Evangelists , ( below ) Mary , the Doctors of the Church and Jesuit saints .
#Text=In 1662 he sculpted the statue of Saint Wenceslaus in the old deanery of the St. Vitus Cathedral of the Prague Castle .
#Text=He added to the façade of the St. George Basilica the statues of the founders of the church : Vratislaus I of Bohemia and Mlada , founder of the convent .
#Text=In 1670 he sculpted the Hercules and Cerberus fountain for the imperial garden in the Belvedere of the same castle , setting again a stylistic example for Bohemian sculpture .
#Text=He sculpted a statue of a saint for the high altar of St. Stephen 's Church in 1678 .

#Text=His last known works are two statues of the national patron saint Saint Wenceslaus ( between 1676 and 1678 ) , one on a column near the Charles Bridge and an equestrian statue on Wenceslas Square ( transferred to Vyšehrad in 1879 ) .
#Text=He is considered the first important Bohemian Baroque sculptor .
#Text=His sculptural style was imitated by many successors .
#Text=Some of his statues can be seen at the National Gallery in the St. George Convent in the Prague Castle .
